column1: The Desolation of the Dragon (or the Desolation of Smaug) was the wasted
column2: unpeopled lands around Lonely Mountain and Dale
column3: charred and blackened by the burning breath of Smaug the Dragon.
column4: p. 208 The borders of the Desolation harboured a little clinging greenery and life
column5: but its heart was scorched and utterly barren. The desolate lands extended southwards some miles along the banks of the River Running from Smaugs lair beneath the Lonely Mountain
column6: but the lands to the north of the mountain seem to have suffered even more fiercely. After Smaugs death
column7: it seems that the Desolation was slowly reclaimed
column8: so that both Erebor and Dale were eventually to recover from their destruction and prosper once again.
